title: Scuba diving, swimming with sharks and taking selfies: how the over 50s are enjoying a 'second wind'
text: You will have heard of the midlife crisis and perhaps the 'quarter life crisis' as stages in a person’s life. There are rites of passages aplenty as we grow older, but one that hasn’t been so well recognised is the ‘second wind’. According to a new study, Britons experience a ‘second wind’ of life aged 54. Swimming with sharks is on the over 50s to-do list Photo: Alamy The study of 2,000 adults, conducted by Vauxhall, found that a real sense of YOLO – you only live once – is prominent during our 20s, specifically aged 24, but comes back for another round 30 years later. It’s when we get to 50 that the mental ante is upped, and we begin to try out experiences we hadn’t dared to before. Over 50s are more likely to swim with sharks than willingly show signs of ageing and slowing down. Going scuba diving , taking selfies and signing up to social media are also amongst the activities that we take on as we grow in age, aiming to recapture our youth. The older generation have taken to social media Photo: Alamy And while the older generation are keen to save for future investments , they are using their life savings to pour money into exciting new experiences. The study runs to coincide with Vauxhall’s newly-launched VIVA, the first version of which was brought to our roads 50 years ago. "Times have changed since the days of hitting 50 and feeling past it,” Denis Chick, communications director of Vauxhall Motors said. Joe Biden poses for a selfie with a fan Photo: AP "There's a general belief that being impulsive is for the young. "But our research shows a growing trend for those in their fifties, sixties and beyond becoming more adventurous than they were in their twenties." The This Girl Can campaign , which aims to get women and girls, of all shapes and sizes, active, has gained significant traction, and Vauxhall's research has been developed into the 'This Gran Can' campaign. The study also showed that eight in ten of the adults polled said they feel just as young now as they did when they were in their 20s. Over half said that they resent being thought of as being ‘past it’. Cheers! Photo: Alamy ‘This Gran Can’ has put together a list of the top 25 activities that the over 50s are enjoying. Flirting with someone younger, booking big travel trips, and going to Zumba classes are amongst those on the list. But how many float your boat? Top 25 activities that the over 50s are enjoying Booking last-minute holidays Signing up to social media Dipping into the 'life savings' for treats Booking a big travel trip Buying clothes from the high street Flirting with someone younger Going to music festivals Taking selfies Camping Going on a girls/lads holiday Learning a foreign language Going on a road trip Giving excuses not to babysit Going to Zumba Taking up a new sport Reading graphic novels Getting a tattoo Hitting karaoke bars Going clubbing Learning to play an instrument Swimming with sharks Going scuba diving/snorkelling Skinny-dipping Signing-up to online dating Starting a Salsa class Find out more about This Gran Can at vauxhall.co.uk/thisgrancan telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegoodlife
